pullRequest.title: Add a Warning on expose endpoint password
pullRequest.bodyText:
Purpose
Fixes: wso2/product-apim-tooling#228
Goals
Add a message to the user, so that the user can import already exported APIs without getting an error because of the endpoint password is missing but the security is enabled by eliminating the contradicting situation.
Approach
Add a Warning message as below on the page Migrating APIs to Different Environments.

User stories

Users can refer the documentation here when he/she wants to import an exported API with Secure Endpoint enabled and the endpoint password exposed.
Users can refer the documentation here when he/she wants to import an exported API with Secure Endpoint enabled and the endpoint password was not exposed.

commit.message: Add a Warning on expose endpoint password

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                If you have enabled Secure Endpoint (Refer [Configuring Environment Specific Parameters]({{base_path}}/learn/api-controller/advanced-topics/configuring-environment-specific-parameters) for more information), the endpoint password will be removed when exporting an API causing an error when you try to import the sane API to an environment. There are 2 solutions for this.
          
          
            
                If you have enabled Secure Endpoint (Refer [Configuring Environment Specific Parameters]({{base_path}}/learn/api-controller/advanced-topics/configuring-environment-specific-parameters) for more information), the endpoint password will be removed when exporting an API causing an error when you try to import the same API to an environment. There are 2 solutions for this.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -277,6 +277,15 @@ You can use the API archive exported from the previous section and import it to
 
     3.  Restart API Manager 3.1.0 server.
 
+!!! warning
+    If you have enabled Secure Endpoint (Refer [Configuring Environment Specific Parameters]({{base_path}}/learn/api-controller/advanced-topics/configuring-environment-specific-parameters) for more information), the endpoint password will be removed when exporting an API causing an error when you try to import the sane API to an environment. There are 2 solutions for this.

commit.message: Correct a typo in secure endpoint content
